verses.verse: Then Moses<WH4872> spoke<WH1696> to the heads<WH7218> of the tribes<WH4294> of the sons<WH1121> of Israel,<WH3478> saying,<WH559> "This<WH2088> is the word<WH1697> which<WH834> the Lord<WH3068> has commanded.<WH6680>

"If<WH3588> a man<WH376> makes<WH5087> a vow<WH5088> to the Lord,<WH3068> or<WH176> takes<WH7650> an oath<WH7621> to bind<WH631> himself<WH5315> with a binding<WH632> obligation,<WH632> he shall not violate<WH2490> his word;<WH1697> he shall do<WH6213> according to all<WH3605> that proceeds<WH3318> out of his mouth.<WH6310>
"Also if<WH3588> a woman<WH802> makes<WH5087> a vow<WH5088> to the Lord,<WH3068> and binds<WH631> herself by an obligation<WH632> in her father's house<WH1004> in her youth,<WH5271>

and her father hears<WH1> her vow<WH8085> and her obligation<WH5088> by which<WH632> she has bound<WH834> herself,<WH631> and her father says<WH5315> nothing<WH1> to her, then all<WH2790> her vows<WH2790> shall stand,<WH3605> and every<WH5088> obligation<WH6965> by which<WH3605> she has bound<WH632> herself<WH834> shall stand.<WH631>

"But if<WH518> her father should forbid<WH1> her on the day<WH5106> he hears<WH3117> [of it,] none<WH8085> <WH3605> of her vows<WH3808> or her obligations<WH5088> by which<WH632> she has bound<WH834> herself<WH631> shall stand;<WH5315> and the Lord<WH6965> will forgive<WH3068> her because<WH5545> her father had forbidden<WH3588> her.

"However, if<WH518> she should marry<WH1961> <WH376> while under<WH5921> her vows<WH5088> or<WH176> the rash<WH4008> statement<WH4008> of her lips<WH8193> by which<WH834> she has bound<WH631> herself,<WH5315>

and her husband<WH376> hears<WH8085> of it and says<WH2790> nothing<WH2790> to her on the day<WH3117> he hears<WH8085> [it,] then her vows<WH5088> shall stand<WH6965> and her obligations<WH632> by which<WH834> she has bound<WH631> herself<WH5315> shall stand.<WH6965>

"But if<WH518> on the day<WH3117> her husband<WH376> hears<WH8085> [of it,] he forbids<WH5106> her, then he shall annul<WH6565> her vow<WH5088> which<WH834> she is under<WH5921> and the rash<WH4008> statement<WH4008> of her lips<WH8193> by which<WH834> she has bound<WH631> herself;<WH5315> and the Lord<WH3068> will forgive<WH5545> her.
"But the vow<WH5088> of a widow<WH490> or of a divorced<WH1644> woman, everything<WH3605> by which<WH834> she has bound<WH631> herself,<WH5315> shall stand<WH6965> against<WH5921> her.
"However, if<WH518> she vowed<WH5087> in her husband's house,<WH1004> or<WH176> bound<WH631> herself<WH5315> by an obligation<WH632> with an oath,<WH7621>

and her husband<WH376> heard<WH8085> [it,] but said<WH2790> nothing<WH2790> to her [and] did not forbid<WH5106> her, then all<WH3605> her vows<WH5088> shall stand,<WH6965> and every<WH3605> obligation<WH632> by which<WH834> she bound<WH631> herself<WH5315> shall stand.<WH6965>

"But if<WH518> her husband<WH376> indeed<WH6565> annuls<WH6565> them on the day<WH3117> he hears<WH8085> [them,] then whatever<WH3605> proceeds<WH4161> out of her lips<WH8193> concerning her vows<WH5088> or concerning the obligation<WH632> of herself,<WH5315> shall not stand;<WH6965> her husband<WH376> has annulled<WH6565> them, and the Lord<WH3068> will forgive<WH5545> her.
"Every<WH3605> vow<WH5088> and every<WH3605> binding<WH632> oath<WH7621> to humble<WH6031> herself,<WH5315> her husband<WH376> may confirm<WH6965> it or her husband<WH376> may annul<WH6565> it.

"But if<WH518> her husband<WH376> indeed<WH2790> says<WH2790> nothing<WH2790> to her from day<WH3117> to day,<WH3117> then he confirms<WH6965> all<WH3605> her vows<WH5088> or<WH176> all<WH3605> her obligations<WH632> which<WH834> are on her; he has confirmed<WH6965> them, because<WH3588> he said<WH2790> nothing<WH2790> to her on the day<WH3117> he heard<WH8085> them.
"But if<WH518> he indeed<WH6565> annuls<WH6565> them after<WH310> he has heard<WH8085> them, then he shall bear<WH5375> her guilt.<WH5771>"

These<WH428> are the statutes<WH2706> which<WH834> the Lord<WH3068> commanded<WH6680> Moses,<WH4872> [as] between<WH996> a man<WH376> and his wife,<WH802> [and as] between<WH996> a father and his daughter,<WH1> [while she is] in her youth<WH1323> in her father's house.<WH5271>
